feed.title: Our World in Data
feed.subtitle: Living conditions around the world are changing rapidly. Explore how and why.

entry.title: Humans make up just 0.01% of Earth's life – what's the rest?
entry.summary: Our planet is home to an incredible diversity of organisms. What does the earth's biodiversity look like in the big picture?

entry.title: Child mortality: achieving the global goal for 2030 would be a huge achievement – but we are currently far away
entry.summary: This blog post draws on data and research discussed in our entry on Child Mortality.

entry.title: The global population pyramid: How global demography has changed and what we can expect for the 21st century
entry.summary: This blog post draws on data and research discussed in our entry on World Population Growth and Future Population Growth.

entry.title: India will soon overtake China to become the most populous country in the world
entry.summary: This blog post draws on data and research discussed in our entries on World Population Growth and Future Population Growth.

entry.title: Which are the most patient countries in the world?
entry.summary: A couple of months ago, a group of leading economists published a research paper studying cross-country differences in character traits like patience, risk aversion, reciprocity, altruism, and trust.1

entry.title: How do we know the history of extreme poverty?
entry.summary: This blog post draws on data and research discussed in our entry on Global Extreme Poverty

entry.title: Number of rough sleepers in England has increased more than 250% since 2010

entry.title: The death of UK coal in five charts

entry.title: Our World in Data is at Y Combinator
entry.summary: Usually we write to you from Oxford where it’s often cold and dark. Not this time: for 10 weeks this winter we are in California instead.
